Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I have updated the master branch of my repo with the annual update

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that starts a process where final tests are made (we were testing beta all last week)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and when passed, the komodoplatform repo is updated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at that point exchanges will be notified

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: eta is today to start notifying exchanges

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in spite of the hack and refund process, the team meets the accelerated schedule! this is because i didnt have to do much at all for this release cycle, the team is grown big enough where all aspects there are others than me to handle things. i didnt have much time at all due to having to deal with the hack

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this was indeed a wake up call and we need to definitely improve in this area. there really is no excuse for what happened, that is why i took personal responsibility for it. we will need to slow down the release process a bit and not rush things out, despite users clamoring for new updates

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we also of course, need to be much more aware of upstream attack vectors

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Keytothegate> Yes sounds like reasonable actions. And why abandon Agama when it is pretty tailor-made for the ecosystem use.. Just need to put heavy emphasis on security aspects of the releases. üëç
